Posts.Content: dawnettejh wrote: I am 52 years old and was just diagnosed this morning with Stage pT1c ILC...starting to learn what all these terms mean that I never wanted to learn -- or at least until I was older! What I am reading here makes me feel a bit better, as it seems as with surgery, possible radiation this is highly treatable... Somehow, I want this to not take over my life, I am just recently remarried in July and we were looking forward to the easier time of life...I am hoping to deal with treatment and keep working and doing the normal things we do... Any coping advice would surely be helpful -- I am trying to stay positive... Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Just diagnosed this morning... dawnettejh christina0001

Posts.Content: Dec 10, 2013 08:18PM dawnettejh wrote: Wow, you ladies are great! This first day has been a lot of ups and downs, but as my daughter said, this is day 1 of getting better! I have an MRI scheduled for Thursday morning.... don't know how long it takes to get those results, but hopefully with a scheduled treatment plan things will become clearer...it is all so surreal today/tonight....crying then fine, crying then fine... I plan on working through all of this, also hoping as MsPharoah said that work can be my distraction --
Posts.Title: Just diagnosed this morning... dawnettejh christina0001

Posts.Content: Dec 11, 2013 06:18PM dawnettejh wrote: Good to know about the possible headache -- will plan to work from home tomorrow after that... Very scared about the MRI. From what I am reading it seems as if things are generally worse than the biopsy results suggest? I was feeling better, now, not so much...and then my sister keeps sending me all these things to try -- grapeseed extract, Tagamet before and after surgery... so overwhelming...
Posts.Title: Just diagnosed this morning... dawnettejh christina0001
